website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to containing moisture and odors, this tried and trusted wet bag outdoes the rest and, thanks to its generous dimensions, it easily accommodates up to two day's worth of soiled diapers.
pros: Thick PUL lining with sealed seams effectively prevents leaks and contains odors
Roomy interior holds more than most similarly priced options
Comes with a snap handle for hanging
Available in multiple sizes, prints, and colors
Machine washable and dryer safe on low
cons: Dual layered construction can take a while to dry

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done and washes well and easily with the diapers
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done and washes well and easily with the diapers. We bring this with pre-folds to our LO daycare. The teachers like the reusable bag. And, for anyone questioning how the medium compares to the large, here is a photo comparison of the two. I think the medium is too small for us since she usually goes through 3-4 cloth diapers while at daycare.
customer_reviews.author: A new Fan

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty...small.
customer_reviews.text: I got the size small for inserts while I am out and about and it can barely even fit two. The bag overall is awesome though.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Nice patterms and good materials
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Beautiful design with vibrant colors and quality materials. The bag is slightly larger than the standard small size wet/dry bag and comfortably fits 8 cloth diapers. You could squeeze a couple more in if you really tried. The liner feels very sturdy and the bag holds smells in without a problem. It only has one compartment, so it isn't that functional for a diaper bag, but we use to to transport our daughter's cloth diapers to/from daycare. Overall, it's a great product and fits our needs well.
customer_reviews.author: steel_muffinsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not practical, takes forever to dry/wash
customer_reviews.text: Water gets trapped in the plastic interior pouch during washing cycle. When you flip the plastic back inside of the cloth exterior cover, the whole bag becomes soaking wet. This makes drying it a nightmare. It took me up to two days sometimes, in humid NJ conditions. This is totally impractical considering that my baby isn't going to wait two days to pee/poop. I had to buy a second wet bag, which wouldn't be necessary if this logistical problem didn't exist. Get wet bags that are just ONE layer of waterproof material--the cloth is nice but not worth the hassle and additional headache to what is already the world's most stressful job (MOMMING)
customer_reviews.author: singalingx3

customer_reviews.title: Great for My Pumping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my pump parts (flanges and valves) and it is the perfect size for that! Many wet/dry bags are overly large, so I was looking for something on the smaller side. This is easy to turn inside out to wipe the lining, I feel like I can wipe pretty vigorously without worrying about damaging the bag. The pattern is also so adorable, I'm very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: EricaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Small size is too small, get the medium
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made bag and I love the inner liner. I took one star off because it was smaller than expected. The small size will hold one, maybe two cloth diapers. As such, it’s only useful for quick trips (an hour maybe two out of the house). I did keep the bag because I do think the small size would be useful for soiled clothing. Edited to add: I bought the next size up and it’s the perfect size for my needs. Changing my review to 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: ELM

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this bag so much I bought three!!! It works for so many things! Going to the beach? Grab the bag! Going swimming?? Grab the bag for your wet suit!! Gotta kid? Grab the bag for soiled clothes! Going on a car trip? Grab the bag for solid clothes when your kid spills a milkshake all over himself! Seriously this bag is amazing the straps makes it perfect to hang in the bathroom for wet bag or diapers or whatever you need it washes well just hang dry it or just wipe out the inside liner this bag is amazing just buy it already!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! But....
customer_reviews.text: So I feel like this is such a minor flaw, that it shouldn't affect the review. But, it honestly makes this bag useless for me personally. There is no handle. All of my wetbags have handles so I can attach it to my diaper bag. With cloth diapers, my bag is already full up. The large size does have a handle, but the medium cost me 18 dollars.... I guess I just assumed. Other than that, the quality is amazing and it feels very durable.
customer_reviews.author: bethnicole12

customer_reviews.title: Large size holds water
customer_reviews.text: Holy cannoli, this thing is large and in charge. I needed a large bag because I am plus size and my swim dress never fits in regular size bags. This bag not only fit my swim dress. It also fit my size 11 men’s water sneakers, too! All items have been saturated and there were zero leaks. I did keep the bag upright, so I can’t say the zipper area is leak proof. Highly recommend this bag for those who may have need to fit several wet items.
customer_reviews.author: ETG2000

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: This is well made. I wish it were a little bigger- I use it for my wet swimsuit and towel, and the clothes that I wore to the gym (but not home) With a little stuffing it all fits. I gave it 0 stars for leak proof--this is not a rating--I don't use it for that, so I don't know. It does have a liner, but it seems that at night, after the wet gear is in there all day, the outer cloth seems a bit damp--no bad though, and not enough that the rest of my gym bag is wet.
customer_reviews.author: dandds

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 2 years of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Sort of upset with this product. I liked it at first but now with less than two years of occasional use (I had two of these in rotation in the diaper bag, which I used 1-2 times a month) the bag has lost its water resistance. A damp diaper soaks right through the TPU and makes other cloth in the diaper bag damp with urine. I know it’s not waterproof but I’d expect it to keep things dry when in the bag for an hour or two running errands. The water resistant lining seems to have cracked over time and allows moisture to wick through. I was hoping it to last much longer than it did.
customer_reviews.author: Rabooke

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, but strap comes apart
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these bags and they are great. We have used them for many different things from dirty diapers, to dirty laundry bags when traveling, to wet swimsuits and haven’t had any issues with leaks. They are a good size, but my only issue with them is that the strap handle is not very well constructed. We had the handle on both bags start to come apart. I was able to take it apart and burn the ends of the nylon then reattach it and haven’t had any problems since. Still, for the price I shouldn’t have had to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Love these wet bags!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd wet bag from this company and by far, my favorite! The colors are so vibrant! My other two are the size large as well, but this one is actually slightly bigger than the other two. Which I found to be a nice surprise! I use it for cloth diapers and it works perfectly to contain the smell and wetness from pre-rinsing the diapers. My first one I have owned for a year and a half and it looks the same as it did the day I bought it. I will add, I do not dry these, I let them air dry after washing with my diapers. Highly recommend these wet bags!
customer_reviews.author: L'M

customer_reviews.title: Great Wet bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of wet bag. I have one of the small ones that I take with me almost everywhere - its perfect for a couple cloth diapers or dirty clothes. I had a different large wet bag that has done ok over the last couple years but after a day or so you could see the dampness from the diapers on the outside of the bag. So I finally decided to buy a Planet Wise large wet bag and it works perfectly; its easy to clean and most importantly it doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Good product with multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a nice wet diaper bag. It’s large enough to fit a day’s worth of cloth diapers (newborn). You might fit 4 or 5 full size diapers in the large size. They do break down over time in regard to their waterproof quality if you dry them in the dryer. I would recommend line drying to help them last longer. In addition to cloth diapers, these wet bags are great for other uses, such as wet bathing suit storage from the pool to home in order to keep other contents in your bag dry. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: just right for diapers
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag for dirty or clean cloth diaper storage. It seems to hold just the right amount for a full load of diaper washing (15 pocket style). When I wash the bag, it takes a while to dry (because it's water resistant). The snap handle is great for hanging from the changing table. I can see this bag being useful for other things when diapers aren't part of my life: trips to the beach, camping, dirty laundry bag.
customer_reviews.author: gtownrunner

customer_reviews.title: I love these! Where were these 6 years ago with ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Where were these 6 years ago with my first? Got throw up clothes? No need to ask everyone for a plastic baggy! Got a poopy diaper you are ashamed to put in a bathroom at a friends house? No big deal (although I recommend disposable small plastic diaper bags as well just to ensure no mess). These things are awesome! I love how easy to clean and convenient this bag is. I keep one in each diaper bag with a few plastic disposables and I am never whispering to a host "Excuse, my kid decided to create a new color of poop. Where can I put this?"
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love Planet Wise!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the fiesta pattern in medium for a friend who is expecting and I’m so very pleased with the colors. I had these when my twins were born because I used cloth diapers and I ended up buying several sizes because they are so useful. This is one of those items that every parent should have, but may not even think of it. Perfect for throwing a dirty outfit in when you’re on the go!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Cossick

customer_reviews.title: Handy for diapers and messy toddlers
customer_reviews.text: The large size is perfect for taking swimming or taking along in case of full scale messes on outings. It makes it easy to let him have cotton candy at the zoo or whatever. It held lots of diapers when we used it that way, now that he's toilet trained, we use it for accidents or messy days. It holds 2-3 full outfits (at the 3T size) with room to spare. The zipper and handle have held up to almost 3 years of use -- unlike some of the smaller ones we have had. I'm very pleased and hope it'll continue to work for a few more years!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised that this bag didn't leak. I use it to transport two soaking wet swimsuits from the gym (my gym doesn't have a swimsuit dryer). The bag doesn't seem as durable as I would have hoped, but it does do the job (for now). It came with a funky smell and might need to be washed or rinsed before first use.
customer_reviews.author: teejay

customer_reviews.title: Fits well inside 30gal step can
customer_reviews.text: We own 2 large and 2 small of these for cloth diapering. I use regular office clips to secure the large size inside a 30gal step can because the standard diaper pail design doesn't work. Here is the product I bought:  Hopefully this takes the guesswork out of it for a future mom or dad.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this item and a great price. Was looking for a wet bag for my daughters drinks, in sippy cups on the go, because sometimes they leak overtime or being dropped and so on. Bag worked great and it was an awesome bag. I love the quality and also the cute design. Worked well for what I needed it for. Will buy throw brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Leaks. Smells come through.
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I used this bag it leaked. I sent it to the daycare and they placed damp (not soaked or dripping) training pants in it. 2 pair. They were in the bag for approximately 3 hours. The dampness was coming through the bag from inside to outside. And the SMELL came through too. These do not hold the smell in. Doesn't seem to be any way to contact the seller so I am stuck with this one. But, beware. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: The only product I recommends to new moms!
customer_reviews.text: This little bag went with me everywhere. It saw everything from back poop to potty training. Doesn't matter what I put inside I can put it straight back in my bag and it stay totally clean. It holds so many items its hard to believe its so small. And quality wise it looks like I just got it yesterday (my daughter is almost 3 so I have it for about 3 years!). LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Lichi

customer_reviews.title: We cloth diaper and these bags work great for keeping smells away on the go
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husbands diaper bag after I had gotten a larger size and different color for myself. We cloth diaper and these bags work great for keeping smells away on the go. They clean easy and hold about 6 dirty diapers. I was sad this bag didn't seem as quality as the larger size we had ordered. The outer shell is stiffer and attracts so much lint, even when we line dry it doesn't look very nice. Now that we have been using the bags for awhile, I wish we had gone with the larger option.
customer_reviews.author: TheHadleyHome

customer_reviews.title: Durable and versatile
customer_reviews.text: These bags are working great for our baby’s cloth diapers. Even if you arent doing cloth they are still a really great bag for poop blowouts, wet clothes or anything else you can think of. I usually throw the whole bag in with the dumped out contents right into our washing machine and wash everything together. No issues so far after 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Just What an Organized Person Needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to carry various items in my backpack which includes a spray and different types of wet wipes. In the past, I have experienced the spray bottle leaking into my purse and didn't want another ruin one. The material is very nice and it's a true navy...rich in color.
customer_reviews.author: Marjo63

customer_reviews.title: Loveeeee love love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I bought it in the carnival skull print. We use alva pocket diapers and I can fit about 10 at a time in the bag. Its cute, and it does it's job! We live in Mississippi and it's incredibly humid and the air is always wet and sticky here, so if you leave the diapers in the bag to long it does not do well to contain the smell, but when you're out and about you can't tell at all! I've used this for a couple of months now daily and it is washed every two days. It has held up fine and still looks as good as new!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Great travel accessory for family vacation.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for taking swimsuits that haven’t dried yet at the end of vacation and it is perfect- we are a family of 4 and sometimes there are more than 4 suits still a little damp at the end of the trip, it is great and would be good for separating dirty clothes after travel too.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely, without a doubt this is a superior product for my intended use!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this design!!! I purchased for my daughter's swim days at summer camp so she wouldn't come home with a wet backpack or worse a plastic bag housing the wet suit and towel. It was roomy enough for a large beach towel(rolled up), bathing suit and an underwater mask....WITH ROOM TO SPARE! When she returns with the wet items in this bag, I remove them and thank the stars NO CHLORINE smell lingers! Win win for this mama!
customer_reviews.author: TrinahMar3

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied with these bags
customer_reviews.text: Very Satisfied with these bags. I have been using the large and small bag for over 3 years now and no real complaints. The big bag goes through lots of washing about 2 x's a week in hot/cold water and the cotton outside started to fray and get small holes about 6 months ago. And when the bag gets full (I usually wash every 3-4 days) it does start to smell like urine. But With all the washing that it goes through I am not surprised, it is cotton and not polyester- natural fibers don't last forever. The small bag is great for travel and holds 1 diaper (we use econobum) well.
customer_reviews.author: NLP

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I use this small wet bag for pre-wet cloth wipes at day care. I realize it is not supposed to be waterproof, but these wipes are just damp (NOT sopping wet) and when his bag comes home at the end of the day, the outside of this bag is damp too. The zipper is also tiny and would be more user-friendly with a ribbon through it. The small would hold ONE diaper if you're looking to use it for something else.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is way off.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this product. I already had one in large and decided to order the cactus print in large. The size of the cactus print is much smaller and didn't have the snap closure for hanging as pictured. I would not recommend this product since sizing is very inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great for Swimmers too!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Wet/Dry Bag from Planet Wise! I use it to put my wet swim suit in after water aerobics, and I liked it so well, I bought another one to carry my water shoes! This is so much better than using plastic grocery bags inside my gym bag, and keeps everything nice and dry in my bag until I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Liz FlaglerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wet bag with a cute design!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought more of these! My husband and I use the bag when we go on trips with our little one. When we don't bring cloth diaps this is perfect for laundry on short trips as well. I love the pattern too, so cute! We haven't had a problem with leaks or smells and this is easier to wash than the diaper pail bags planetwise sells.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Souza

customer_reviews.title: The best wet/dry bags around!
customer_reviews.text: We love this wet bag. I cloth diaper my baby and we use this in his diaper bag to put his dirty diapers in. I have other sizes from Planet Wise and never have any leaks. I do have Wegreeco brand and it smells a little in my diaper pail after a few uses. Planet Wise is more pricey but the quality is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Huezo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cloth pads
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the large sized bag for my son's diapers, so I thought I would stick with this brand and get the small one for my cloth menstrual pads until I wash them. I can fit about 6 in it, which is perfect for my needs. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: FarmGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Very small.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality! When they say one diaper change though... They mean it. Super tiny. I can barely stuff one cloth diaper in it and zip it up. I needed one slightly larger, so I'm going to get a medium size. I'm certain I'll find a use for this one though.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Bostic

customer_reviews.title: Love my bag
customer_reviews.text: I love my PlanetWise bag! I got the large size and it's big enough to hold a few days worth of diapers before laundry day. The print I got (Unicorn) did fade a little bit after the first wash so the colors aren't as brilliant as they were when I got it. But other than that it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until the zippers broke
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 little ones wearing cloth diapers and wanted to contain the diapers and the smell when changing them upstairs. We only changed them upstairs once or twice a day. We only had up to 8 diapers in the bag at a time, and there was much more room left in the bag! It contained the smell and contained all moisture. We bought 2 of these bags, though, and the zipper broke on both of them after just a few months. Luckily, they weren't expensive, but I would buy a different brand next time, hoping it will hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Wet Bags
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these that I use for my baby's cloth diapers. We use AIOs, and so far, the most I've put in a bag at one time was 8 diapers/wipes, and there was still room for several more diapers, so these are quite roomy. They keep the diaper smell in, and wash up well, too. (Plus there are such cute patterns!) Update: One year later, these are still going strong. We now wash diapers every other day, and each bag holds 14-20 diapers. I'm very pleased with these bags!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Compston

customer_reviews.title: Priceless and perfect
customer_reviews.text: We are still using this two and a half years later. Don't dry it in a dryer, pull the inside liner out and hang it with the cloth covering above it and it dries fast and is great for laundry in suitcases on trips. We used it for all the dirty and wet cloth diapers and the smell stay in and it never stained.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Matos-French

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! The loop fits on a hook that was already over the bathroom door and I can simply place all my undergarments and other unmentionables in it easily during the week, even while seated. It is super easy to take to the washer, empty by inverting the bag and either wipe it down or toss it in the wash as well. Excellent Construction!
customer_reviews.author: MotherY

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is actually a whole inch smaller in either direction. It also has started to fray. Which is ridiculous since we’ve only been using it 2 weeks! The medium size bags also suck. They’re only 12x14. Which is not 12x16!! Also. Read carefully. Only the large bag has a strap.
customer_reviews.author: 🌷🌷🌷

customer_reviews.title: Great wet bag
customer_reviews.text: Love these bags! I have them in our baby bag for soiled clothes which has been used and washed many times already. I also use another one to hold my breast pump parts which is great.
customer_reviews.author: RHH

customer_reviews.title: Cute and durable, but--
customer_reviews.text: Cute and durable but not as waterproof as I would wish. Also--after a year or so of twice-weekly laundering, the metal zipper is starting to oxidize. We had the munchkin brand wet bag before (same size), which doesn't have the huge variety in designs, but is much more waterproof and also more functional, as it has a snapping nylon loop/snap closure, as well as a mesh outer pocket. The munchkin bag hasn't held up as well though--the plastic interior lining cracks over time. I guess it's a trade-off. We cloth diaper, and these things get hard use. They aren't meant to wear forever.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great leak proof wet bag.
customer_reviews.text: We keep this in the diaper bag at all times. It can hold 2 cloth or 3 disposable diapers at one time. We had to buy a second because the first got caught in a drier and the lining tore. Don't put it in the drier, it dries pretty fast when you hang it anyway. Even if you're not cloth diapering I would recommend this wet bag. I've put muddy shoes, wet/dirty clothes, garbage and all sorts of other stuff in it.
customer_reviews.author: Al Kells

customer_reviews.title: Great at keeping in the stink
customer_reviews.text: Great at keeping in the stink, but a little annoying to wash/dry. I invert the bag to wash, then re-insert the lining - sometimes it is still dripping wet, and I have to hang it outside to dry, then invert it again to get it fully dry all over. I plan on purchasing another to make my cloth diapering life easier, but wanted to use the bag for a few months to see how well it held up. I've been using this bag for a few months, always hung to dry, never dried in the drier and it has held up wonderfully. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jas S.

customer_reviews.title: The bag looked like the picture but was I disappointed it was not ...
customer_reviews.text: I placed my wet bathing suit in the bag and draped it over the shower rod. Water dripped out of the zipper and was not as waterproof as described. The bag looked like the picture but was I disappointed it was not as waterproofed as I expected. I will still use it for a travel bag because it would be acceptable for packing delicate items.
customer_reviews.author: YMCA Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wet bag
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this bag. Heavy duty, I se it and wash it constantly... i even dry it which I probably shouldnt and it still is super awsome. I have had it probably almost a year now.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing to take to the amusement/water park
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing to take to the amusement/water park!!! You can swim and then throw your towels and suits in here then in the backpack and everything wet stays inside and everything else stays dry! PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The bag itself is good. It doesn't take up any smells from my ...
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is good. It doesn't take up any smells from my gym clothes, it doesn't leak when there are wet items, etc. My only complaint the the handle/strap thing, which has a snap on it...meaning that if your bag is heavy enough while carrying it with the handle, it will snap apart and be useless. This bag would be a ton better if it came with an over-the-shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Robins

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, sturdy and cute!
customer_reviews.text: So cute. Holds tons of diapers. I had 17 + diapers of sorts ( prefold&covers, flats&covers, pocket&inserts plus tons of clothe wipes) and still had plenty of room. I've washed it multiple times and hang dry it. My ONLY complaint is the closed zipper corner gets slightly tucked in when it's hung up. But that's the only reason its not 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Using for 2 years and still in good condition!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have been using this size large bag for 2 years now and I'm impressed it lasted this long. I washed and dried it about 3 times a week and it's just now starting to wear out. Last week the zipper broke off so I just put a safety pin on it which works just fine. I would say it's definitely worth the money you pay for it!
customer_reviews.author: KettleCornwall

customer_reviews.title: Cute wet bag, great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Super cute! I bought this to have in the diaper bag for our baby due in January. The print celestial sea is adorable! We are not cloth diapering but wanted something for wet items and this looks to be perfect. We’ve used it for a couple of trips over thanksgiving and it holds up well. Can’t wait to use it with baby!
customer_reviews.author: Goldsmith E

customer_reviews.title: I like that the inside is a bright blue so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have so far only just washed and air dried it. Drying did take longer than I was initially expecting but it is winter and my garage gets cold at night. I will say the background is more of a brown than a black but that doesn't bother me at all. I like that the inside is a bright blue so I will easily be able to see into it. I will hopefully update my review after my baby is born and I can get some use out of it for cloth diapers. I am hoping to buy a second one in a different print soon.
customer_reviews.author: katharine

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and cute too
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot larger than the first wet diaper bag I had and it is also better quality too. If using reusable diapers you will need a wet bag that holds up with all the washing a it will get. My first bag lasted about 6 months and then the fabric started shredded at the zipper and was no longer usable. This bag is very good quality and really not a bad price. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kisha

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I already purchased the small wet bag and loved it. We now needed a large wet bag so we purchased the larger size. These bags are so cute and very useful. We use them for our cloth diapers while our son is at the sitters.
customer_reviews.author: Maryka DeBusk

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: I got the large wet bag and it’s a tad smaller than expected, but I do love it. Planet Wise wet bags are by far my favorite wet bags for cloth diapers. This large one is hung in the bathroom for when I spray off poopy diapers. It holds about 3-4 days worth, which is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Katlynn

customer_reviews.title: Solid useful wetbag for a day trip
customer_reviews.text: This size is perfect for an afternoon out. The colors and print are exactly as pictured. It washes well and has faded a bit but that is to be expected. I use it once per week and when we get home it gets turned inside out into our diaper pail and washed along with my prefolds covers and pail liner when it is laundry time. I have never had any leaks or other issues yet. Reviewed after 5+ months of use
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Rae

customer_reviews.title: good bag for storing dirty diapers
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bag, but I thought it would be bigger. It did seem to contain the smell and kept all the wetness inside. I think for me, it held about 15-18 diapers including inserts. I bought two of these though; one for my laundry room and one for my MIL. I also bought two small wet/dry bags for on the go. I was disappointed though that my second Planet Wise diaper bag, the strap broke after the first use. This one, however, still works.
customer_reviews.author: I’m a Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great, multi-function bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality just like all the other Planet Wise wet bags. Keeps moisture and smell contained. I send this bag to his nanny's house during the day and it easily holds 5 BumGenius Elemental diapers and a change of clothes with room to spare. Plus this bag is just beautiful- not a huge fan of babyish baby gear. My son (or my husband and I) will be able to use this long into the future for swimming, camping, travel, etc. Only tip is to pull lining inside out when washing and line drying so it gets cleaner and dries properly. Usually dumping out the diapers does this automatically.
customer_reviews.author: A. Combs

customer_reviews.title: Great for twins in flat diapers
customer_reviews.text: This bag holds enough flat diapers for a full day for my twin babies. It is easy to use and holds in the stink. It's kinda a pain to launder though, as water is retained in the waterproof bag and some soap with it too... but not much... it hasn't effected the absorbency of our diapers. I've been using this for two months and bought two to rotate. The snap is not strong enough to hold a full day of diapers for twins so it often sits on the floor by the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for keeping the stink out of your house when cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: As a cloth diapering mother of two, containing the smell of the contents held within these bags is critical. I currently utilize two of these bags, one hanging on my bedroom door, and have never had an issue with smells resonating from the bags. They're excellent quality and hold a fair amount of diapers for my needs. I've never been as satisfied with other brands of wet bags and recommend this brand to family and friends looking into cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: MMS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to keep in the diaper changing area to store cloth diapers once dirty. So far, it's held up well through the wash and hanging. I do hang it to dry. The pattern is very cute. I love the snap handle so that I can attach it anywhere. The bag holds a good amount of diapers. I was every other day and there's definitely enough room to hold all the diapers. While in the wash, the waterproof inside will come out, but it's easy to push it back in. It probably dries faster with the waterproof inside layer coming out anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Best Wet Bag Around
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these large bags, and keep them in rotation. I cloth diaper my twins, and wash about every other day. There is never any stink and nothing leaks through the bag. It's easy to just toss right in the washing machine along with the diapers. It holds 12-14 soiled diapers easily. When washing, just be sure to turn the bag fully inside out. I didn't a couple of times, and, well I guess it continued to do it's jon right there in the washer because when I took it out, it was actually full of water. So, pull the liner fully out and it will be smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Saly

customer_reviews.title: The zipper is sturdy, the seams are strong
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. The zipper is sturdy, the seams are strong. This is the second one we bought- its small enough to not warrant a handle but it easily fits a change of clothes for my 6yo along with his goggles, sunscreen and even water shoes. The liner has proven to be of great quality as well compared to some of the thinner linings of other wet bags. We can fit a thinner towel in if its just with a change of clothes.
customer_reviews.author: CholsM

customer_reviews.title: Planet Wise wet bags are the best for cloth diapering families
customer_reviews.text: I love planet wise wet bags. I cloth diapered (until recently potty-training) for 18 months, and used two large wetbags for dirty diaper storage in between washes. I did use disposables sometimes when out at stores, etc, but when it came time to potty train, it was helpful to have a medium size bag with us for potential wet clothes. Since these bags aren't used for diapers/wet clothes anymore, I use them to store cloth cleaning rags/ bibs/ napkins from our kitchen/ dining room. When baby #2 comes, I definitely intend to keep one of these in the diaper bag with us.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fits one “all-in-one” cloth diaper
customer_reviews.text: The dimensions are posted, but it was still smaller than I expected. I use bum genius Freetime diapers and this wet bag will fit only one dirty diaper. It’s actually perfect though, I just keep two of these in my diaper bag and if I only use one then I still have a second one clean.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, SMALL DOES NOT HOLD 2!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag in "Small" because it says it was 8x10 inches and holds 1-2 diapers. 8x10 inches...barely. The one cloth diaper I bought with this fits into the bag with the insert. There is no way I would be fitting a second diaper inside unless I really cram it in there. I am disappointed, I would have bought the size up for more room if the specs had said the small only holds 1 diaper. Otherwise, the bag is well made and very cute. I just can't justify purchasing an additional medium and I threw away the packaging before I thought to return it.
customer_reviews.author: cmdaven

customer_reviews.title: so that sucked, but out of the 10 or so that ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these bags for about 1-1/2 years, and we use them a lot (weekly). For the money, I would say they are just okay. The liners start to wear out after about a year, so we have replaced several of ours. I recently purchased one and it tore at the seam, so that sucked, but out of the 10 or so that we've purchased, it's only happened with the one. The zipper has busted on two or three of them. These are the only bags that fit the bin at daycare, so we have continued using them but would love a more durable alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Purplefairyfarts

customer_reviews.title: Love the black
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love that planet wise made this black wet bag, I cloth diaper my son and have struggled to find a "normal looking" wet bag to match my black juicy couture diaper bag, and this was perfect. I have size medium which does in fact hold about 6 pocket diapers max, the best for going out. Also love that it isn't a wet/dry bag, I don't know if it's just me but I hate those so this was as good as it gets. And completely functional. I filled mine with water to test the waterproof ness of it and let me say I was pleasantly surprised not a drop of water came out.
customer_reviews.author: NancyRojas

customer_reviews.title: No hanging loop
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a second wet bag for my son's diapers. Have a planet wise wet/dry bag already, and I can say that these products work very well to hold in wetness and odor. Decided to buy a wet bag (rather than the wet/dry option) since I don't use the dry pouch on my other one, and this one was a few dollars cheaper. Was disappointed, however, when this one arrived an it did not have the hanging loop as it does in the photo (purchased the aqua swirl print). I'm sure the bag will perform sufficiently, but would have paid the extra for the wet/dry option had I known this one did not have the loop.
customer_reviews.author: jillv

customer_reviews.title: If treated right, these bags can last YEARS
customer_reviews.text: I love the Planet Wise wet bags, this was my second one, for my second child. I actually probably wouldn't have had to purchase this one, but I always washed my first in hot water with the diapers and it lost it's water repellency, but I didn't follow the proper directions, so it was my own fault. We used this bag weekly for dirty cloth diapers, and it lasted two + years, so for the price it was a great deal. Now that the kids are older, we use the bags for wet bathing suits in the summer, or for other soiled items when on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly to contain wet items
customer_reviews.text: Large bag that holds a lot. Strap to hang it is nice addition. Wish my smaller bag had this option too. Keeps wet items contained.
customer_reviews.author: Sally A. Short

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, fades with washes, but remains in working condition.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this wet bag for several months now. I love the Monster Mash pattern. I wash the bag along with my diapers for every load and it has held up well with the exception of significant fading. The bag started with a dark navy blue background and is now a dark blue-gray. That is purely a cosmetic problem, however, the zipper, hand and snap are all in perfect working order. The PUL remains in good condition and I do dry it in the dryer. It could stand to be a little larger in size. It holds two days work of diapers, but sometimes we go three days between washes.
customer_reviews.author: Hospital Rat

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and machine washable
customer_reviews.text: Love these wet bags! We have two in the diaper bag and you can throw dirty diapers or soiled clothes in them and put them in the diaper bag. They’re machine washable and I have never smelled any poo or mildew even if I forget to take them out for a day.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity H. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bag works well, I have 2 and this allows me to throw one in the wash with the diapers inside and still be out while my diapers are washing/drying. After having this bag and using our diapers, I might have preferred to have the smaller size for errands and other outings when I know I'll most likely only go through 1 or 2 diapers as I believe they would fit in the smaller bag. This bag could easily fit 5-7 diapers (depending on type). I've had no issues with leaking, and love the quality. Would definitely buy from Planet Wise again.
customer_reviews.author: FamOf4

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag but takes forever to dry. When you want to use them every day, it's hard to keep them washed and dried for the next day. UPDATE: BUT, this is the best wet bag!!! I absolutely love it and I don't have to wash it after every use! The bag doesn't hold much of an odor (chlorine, wetness, etc.) so I wash it once a week. Such a fun print and keeps in ALL the wetness. I will be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: Loooove the pattern on this! (Got the one that looks like a coloring page) the colors are beautiful and vibrant! Having used it much, our baby is only 4 weeks old. But we cloth diaper and know it will get much use!
customer_reviews.author: J.Gold

customer_reviews.title: I use these to hold my wet gym clothes each day until I can get them to my hamper
customer_reviews.text: Great wet bag! If you're a van dweller of any type, then this bag is a great alternative to owning the self-contained wash bag that most will try to sell on us. If you do your own laundry, then get the "Large" of this bag and it will contain your dirty laundry until you can get to a laundry mat.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Small bag is TINY. Holds only one diaper.
customer_reviews.text: The small bag is tiny and holds only one cloth diaper. (for example Fuzzibunz one size) This won't work for even part time day care where they need to send home two or three diapers a day. Otherwise, the pattern is cute and seems well made. I prefer the size of the. It has a place for clean diapers and another for dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Kris H

customer_reviews.title: Amaaaaaazaaanng!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingggg my first wet bag!! And I love it ! It’s so big and spacious just as I thought! It passed the water proof test! I mainly bought it for swim wear use after swimming . Only part that leaked was the zipper area since the zipper isn’t waterproof best $21 I’ve spent !
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love planet wise wet bags. I have been cloth diapering for almost two months and these wet bags make it so convenient and easy. I hang one (large) on the changing table and just throw soiled diapers in it after diaper change, then launder them every 1-2 days. This bag contains the smell really well and prevents me from having to touch soiled diapers when washing them. I just dump diapers out into washing machine and then drop bag into wash as well. Super easy. I keep the medium wet bag in the diaper bag for use when we are out and about. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Peterson

customer_reviews.title: These bags are awesome! We use different sizes for g-tube feeding supplies ...
customer_reviews.text: These bags are awesome! We use different sizes for g-tube feeding supplies and food, as well as dirty clothes or wet swimming items. We have had some of the bags for a couple years and machine wash them and so far they have held up great! I also love the monster pattern even more in person!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, and got worse
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased two of these when we started cloth diapering a little over a year ago. They lasted about a year, and then the zipper broke on both bags. Not ideal, but not the worst either. I would hope products like this would last longer, but they got hard daily use. We were satisfied enough to order two more from the same company. Unfortunately, these two were destroyed in less than a month. The stitching ripped on one bag causing the lining to separate from the outer layer and the zipper, and the handle ripped out of the other. We are returning both.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, has many uses
customer_reviews.text: I love these bags, and hope to get them in smaller sizes. The quality is great, and both the external and internal fabrics have stood up to abuse, poop, sweat, and detergent. (I wash it on cold water delicate to hopefully maintain the color.) I suspect other more fashionable patterns would work great for gym clothes, or even the smaller bags for sneakers. I highly recommend this product! One small personal opinion -- it's neat that a snap hanging-strap is included, but I sometimes feel like at its fullest, the bag is too heavy and starts to stretch where the strap is attached. So, I don't use it. No big deal.
customer_reviews.author: sothlice

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a while now for cloth diapers - well, about 5 months consistently. This holds a lot more diapers than the small size - probably at least 8-10. Which is nice for the sitter's house for a day while I am at work. It really does contain the smell of urine/feces and contains any of the liquid (but its all absorbed in the diapers anways). The colors have really been washed out. I wash this once per week with the Tiny Bubbles detergent (for cloth diapers) and hang it dry. Other than that, this works great!
customer_reviews.author: New Mom

customer_reviews.title: but these bags make great "sweaty workout clothes bags
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of these bags, this is my third. I don't have a baby, and don't currently have a need for diaper cleanup, but these bags make great "sweaty workout clothes bags." I have a fancy gym bag and I really don't like to put sweaty clothes in it (since I can't really clean the gym bag). Using these bags INSIDE my gym bag protects the bag from sweaty attacks and keeps the wet clothes totally contained without leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and functional but pricey in comparison
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. I love the owl print, super cute. 2. Keeps moisture in really well. Cons: 1. No strap on the medium size 2. Outside liner tends to shrink a little 3. Gets funky and needs an extra washing it two occasionally. 4. Super pricey for what it is. I got some others that work just as well for 1/3 of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact, convenient, and conceals discreetly. Perfect for smaller items and kids'clothes!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to use this for soiled or wet clothing yet, but am familiar with the brand. Right now I have it packed as a Mommy backup bag with an extra pair of undies, feminine hygiene kit, and extra shirt inside my diaper bag. The size is perfect, about 6x9 and folds down wonderfully. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I use these bags for dirty spit up bibs and onesies that my son spits ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually do not cloth diaper. I use these bags for dirty spit up bibs and onesies that my son spits up on throughout our day. It's nice to keep the dirty clothes in here to keep the sour spit up smell hidden. Highly recommend this bag even for other purposes besides cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kinney

customer_reviews.title: It is soooo small!
customer_reviews.text: The good: it is well made and very good quality and the size is as advertised 7in. by 10in. The bad: you can maybe put 1 or 2 dirty cotton diapers in there but the narrow opening makes it a tight potentially messy squeeze. Bottom line : I really wish I had ordered the size up, this size is pretty much useless. I wonder what other people use this for...
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome diaper wet bag
customer_reviews.text: Awesome wet bag. Perfect for holding dirty cloth diapers (keeps the smell at bay, doesn't leak, and can be washed, can't ask much more). My son absolutely loves the design, too. We have it hanging up near the changing table and he is completely mesmerized by this one (and the owls)...he now even tries to grab them (both good and bad!). We also use this at daycare and it works great for transporting diapers back and forth. We had the owl version first and loved it so much we got this one - glad we did!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Need better zipper design
customer_reviews.text: The inside of the bag is good however the zipper doesn't really zip tight so I don't know how it keeps the odor from coming out. I think a cooler bag would been better and sturdier for the price range. It is pretty convenient how easily you can fold it and put it inside a purse, it doesn't take up much space. Also I expected it to be slightly larger (I know measurements were listed but just saying).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 YEAR UPDATE: DON'T BUY, FELL APART
customer_reviews.text: 1 YEAR UPDATE: DON'T BUY. just after 1 year of us, this bag fell apart (see pics). it's now totally unusable for cloth diapering as the inner lining cracked and holes formed on the outside, allowing wetness and terrible smells to seep thru. I contacted Planet Wise customer service and they were of no help, telling me I didn't wash it properly which is absolutely not true as I was very diligent in the process
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: I liked it at first, but it failed after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Seems like Planetwise is definitely top choice in wetbags. Great quality, beautiful patterns and keeps smells contained. I want another one for when this one goes in the wash! **UPDATE:I have only had this bag for about 2 1/2 weeks and the PUL is already failing. I only had 1 soiled diaper in it today & it soaked through the bag onto my carpet. argh! I wash on low then hang dry so Im not sure what is going on. Also mine came with a brown handle instead of the advertised blue. Returning this and need to look for another wetbag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute For Organized Tent Trailer Camping!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love his bag. Great workmanship, cute, practical, washes great. I bought as a laundry bag for camping. All the gross dirty clothes go in until we get to a laundry machine. I find that bigger items like sweaters and jeans you usually keep wearing until you can wash anyway. We only needed a small laundry bag for day to day.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Planet Wise has become my go-to for all similar products!
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this item, and the several other Planet Wise items. We use them to hold cloth diapers once they are dirtied. I can get two diaper liners in the small bag. They have worked great keep moisture and smells in; and after and normal wash and line dry they are good as new. I imagine once we are done with diapers they will start holding wet bathing suite and work just as well. - I have these in several sizes and Planet Wise has become my go-to for all similar products.
customer_reviews.author: Becky B.

customer_reviews.title: waterproof but smelly
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any leak issues with this bag, and it is very cute. I bought a large and it is perfect for washing every 2-3 days, I use flats and a few covers. I've been worried about how it would hold up being washed 2 or 3 times a week so I hang dry it,and it hasn't shown any signs of wear so far. My only issue is that I think it smells, it seems to have a stinky diaper aura. I know that I am a lot more sensitive to smell than others and that may be why other reviewers said it didn't stink. I think it is a good bag though and I don't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: C & C Welton

product_meta.title: Planet Wise Wet Bag, Medium, Jewel Woods (Made in The USA)
product_meta.description: Color:Jewel Woods| Size:MediumThese machine washable, waterproof bags are perfect for carrying your wet and dirty items. Planet Wise wet bags are innovatively sewn with hidden, sealed seams for no leaking. Planet Wise wet bags also resist most odors and stains, keeping smells in. Available in three sizes: small-7.5"x 10", medium-12.5"x 16" and large-17" x 21". Large size comes with snap handle.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA using high quality PVC, BPA, and Lead free materials!
At 12.5" x 15" the Medium Wet Bag is great for wet or dirty items, swimwear, diapers, shoes, cosmetics, gym bag, and the list goes on and on.
Innovative, patent pending, leak-free design resists most odors and stains keeping smells in.
Designer cotton outer with coordinating waterproof inner
Machine wash warm, tumble dry low or hang to dry. No bleach or softeners.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,877 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
